question: 酷似
partsOfSpeech: noun, する verb, の adjective
sourceMnemonic: If you <kanji>resemble</kanji> someone who's <kanji>cruel</kanji>, you, well, you <vocabulary>resemble</vocabulary> them. Maybe you're really mean too. I guess only you can know that. But you do look like that other guy...
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You didn't learn this reading for <ja>似</ja> yet, so here's a mnemonic to help you:

Which cruel guy do you <vocabulary>resemble</vocabulary>? <reading>Je</reading>sus (<ja>じ</ja>), of course. I mean, you look just like him. Look in the mirror if you don't believe me. Look, there he is. Wait, what do you mean he isn't a cruel guy? I guess you're the cruel one then. Sucks to be you.
